publication.citation: Evina Stein, 'Glosses on Isidore, Etymologiae, book 1'

about.p: The glosses to the Etymologiae were transcribed as a part of the NWO VENI project 'Innovating Knowledge: Isidore's Etymologiae in the Carolingian Period' (VENI project 275-50-016) carried out at the Huygens Institute in Amsterdam in 2018-2021.

The glosses to the first book of the Etymologiae are also published separately as E. Steinova and P. Boot, The glosses to the first book of the Etymologiae of Isidore of Seville: a digital scholarly edition, Huygens Institute: Amsterdam, 2021, at: https://db.innovatingknowledge.nl/edition. The editorial standardisation and treatment are discussed in the introductory sections of the digital edition.

The XML encoding of these glosses is described in E. Steinova and P. Boot, 'Editing Glosses as Networks: Exploring the Explorative Edition', in: A Companion to Digital Editing Methods, ed. E. Bleeker et al., forthcoming.

The collection of glosses and layers of glossing in individual manuscripts, including the glossing hands, are analysed in E. Steinova, 'Annotation of the Etymologiae of Isidore of Seville in Its Early Medieval Context', ALMA 78 (2020), 5–81.

The network-based analysis and visualisation of the glosses to the first book of the Etymologiae are discussed in E. Stein, 'Parallel Glosses, Shared Glosses, and Gloss Clustering: Can Network-Based Approach Help Us to Understand Organic Corpora of Glosses?', JHNR 9 (2023), 36–100.
An Excel datasheet with the glosses to the first book of the Etymologiae is published on Zenodo at: https://zenodo.org/records/5767868.
